channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Climate change: UN to reveal landmark IPCC report findings
item.description: The report will be a "massive wake-up call" to governments to cut emissions, environmental experts say.

item.title: Greece wildfires: Strong winds push flames towards villages
item.description: Greece is experiencing its most severe heatwave in 30 years with temperatures reaching 45C (113F).

item.title: Greece wildfires: 'It's like a horror movie but it's real life'
item.description: Thousands of people have had to evacuate Greece's second biggest island as severe wildfires rage.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban capture three regional capitals
item.description: Three cities, including the strategically important Kunduz, fall to the militant group in a single day.

item.title: Dixie Fire: Firefighters tackles historic California wildfire
item.description: The Dixie Fire has burned through more than 463,000 acres and could take weeks to extinguish.

item.title: Mozambique insurgency: Key port retaken from insurgents - Rwanda
item.description: MocÃ­mboa da Praia was the Islamist militants' last stronghold in northern Mozambique, Rwanda says.

item.title: Golfer Kim scores 13 on par three hole
item.description: Finding water five times on one hole saw South Korea's Kim Si-woo score 13 on a par three to record the highest score on the PGA Tour since 1983.

item.title: North Korea: Kim Jong-un calls for relief in flood-hit areas
item.description: More than 1,000 homes have been damaged and about 5,000 people evacuated as a result of flooding.

item.title: Saudi Arabia to allow in vaccinated Umrah pilgrims
item.description: The Islamic holy city of Mecca will allow vaccinated pilgrims to enter, the Saudi authorities say.

item.title: Nigeria kidnappings: Chibok schoolgirl returns home seven years on
item.description: More than 270 girls were seized by Islamist militants in 2014, and many of them are still missing.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Paris St-Germain move 'a possibility' after Barcelona exit
item.description: A tearful Lionel Messi says joining Paris St-Germain from Barcelona is "a possibility, but nothing is agreed".

item.title: Outrage after Zimbabwean girl, 14, dies giving birth at church shrine
item.description: Memory Machaya's death at a church leads to calls for the government to end forced child marriage.

item.title: Why China's climate policy matters to us all
item.description: The global battle against climate change is likely to be won or lost in China.

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: Assam-Mizoram clash: 'It was like a war between two countries'
item.description: A long-running border dispute is affecting relations between two neighbouring Indian states.

item.title: Children's home fire: 'The souls of our daughters are still there'
item.description: The mothers of teenage girls who died in a 2017 fire at a children's home in Guatemala want justice.

item.title: Covid in Sydney: Communities feel under siege as troops deployed
item.description: Residents say they're being treated like second-class citizens to stem a Covid outbreak.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Barcelona star in tears as he receives ovation news conference
item.description: Lionel Messi is distraught as he receives a standing ovation from team-mates, journalists, officials and his family at a news conference confirming his departure from Barcelona.

item.title: North Korea floods: Homes destroyed and thousands evacuated
item.description: The state broadcaster says some regions have seen over 50cm (20in) of rain in three days.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Capturing the perfect moment
item.description: Three sports photographers explain what goes into getting the best shots of the day at the Games.

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Olympic DJs playing in empty stadiums
item.description: DJs have found themselves in the unusual position of playing music in virtually empty Olympic stadiums.
